entry.title: Evan Sheridan
entry.content:
• Research: it is well known that Quantum Monte Carlo simulations are plagued with numerical and statistical errors. The goal of my current research is to try and minimise some of these errors so that that Dynamincal Mean Field Theory (DMFT) calculations (i) become more accurate and (ii) converge faster. To that end, I am developing impurity solvers for the Dynamical Mean Field Theory. With a broader view in mind, I am aiming to use these solvers to investigate the equation of state for strongly correlated systems.

entry.title: Hello World!
entry.content:
It is terribly mundane to entitle my first post “Hello World!” but this is probably the only time in which it has ever had some real meaning. I suppose “initial commit” could also qualify but that is rather pessimistic since I have still some semblance of hope that this blog will be read by somebody other than me (which is currently not the case for the majority of my git repos…must be that .f90 extension…).

To cut a long story short I hope to regularly contribute here about things that I find interesting: which will range from my research, what I am reading (academically and otherwise), what projects I am working on in my spare time to how to do cool things with python and maybe even fortran if you are lucky!

So, stay tuned - ideas are brewing! And on that note: “Goodbye World”.
